infons.section_title_1: Actinobacteria and Fusobacteria should be phyla in there (the other annotations are phylum here, but could be assigned 2 identifiers)

passages.text: The bacterial phyla Actinobacteria, Verrucomicrobia, Fusobacteria and Firmicutes were found differentially expressed in the disease group.

Campylobacter sputorum subsp. sputorum and Campylobacter strain BB120 were strongly associated with disease. Taken as a whole the genus Campylobacter was associated with health, but this association was accounted for by the highly prevalent species C. gracilis and C. showae.

infons.section_title_1: Fusobacteria should be class in here (the other annotations will be class)

passages.text: We also found Clostridia, Acidobacteria, Fusobacteria and Tissierellia in these samples.

infons.section_title_1: Fusobacteria should be genus in here (but because of an exact match it might not, although we should evaluate Latin plurals...)

passages.text: Within the Fusobacteria genus we found several species, including F. nucleatum, Fusibacterium mortiferum and Bacillus naviformis.

infons.section_title_1: This (Actinobacteria) should have multiple IDs and multiple types since we cannot tell which tax rank it is from the rest in the sentence

passages.text: We found Firmicutes, Bacillus, Tissierellia, Fusibacterium nucleatum and Actinobacteria within the cohort.
We found un unknown bacterium yet to be named.

infons.section_title_1: This should be capped in terms of number of identifiers

passages.text: One species of interest was an Flavobacteria bacterium found in 6 individuals.

infons.section_title_1: H. pylori should be tagged as well based on the dictionary (i.e. it is identifier using regular expressions but no match in text so needs to check in dictionary) compared to C. pylori which should be matched based on text - just an example because these are the same one, synonyms...

passages.text: The taxonomic lineage is as follows: Proteobacteria, Epsilonproteobacteria, Campylobacterales, Helicobacteraceae, Gastrospirillum, Campylobacter pylori (C. pylori). The latter is also known as H. pylori.

infons.section_title_1: This should identify both forms of the abbreviated entities, one with capital+period and one without the period.

passages.text: Both F. mortiferum and B naviformis were found in higher abundance in the disease group.

infons.section_title_1: This should not identify an entity called D. coli even though it has the right format and the second part has a species name but the genus capital is not correct.

passages.text: All the colis are Campylobacter coli, Vibrio coli, Bacillus coli, Enterococcus coli, Escherichia coli, Escherichia/Shigella coli, Anguillina coli, Massilioclostridium coli, where E. coli and A. coli should match to but D. coli should not.

infons.section_title_1: This should have 2 identifiers as it should not be resolvable based on the available information.

passages.text: There are two fragilis species that resolve to a genus starting with a letter R. Since no genus has been mentioned in the text, R. fragilis should resolve to two unique identifiers, NCBI:txid817 (bacterium) and NCBI:txid131542 (fungus).

infons.section_title_1: This should resolve to a single identifier (NCBI:txid180942) since the genus is mentioned in the text before the abbreviation is used, but multiple C. fragilis could exist (e.g. NCBI:txid440096, NCBI:txid604061, NCBI:txid2507610, NCBI:txid2690955, NCBI:txid90957).

passages.text: A sequence was identified related to Crepidotus fragilis, which was previously found in another cohort. This study found that C. fragilis was more associated with healthy individuals.

infons.section_title_1: Test to see if lowercase names and different capitalisation of words can be found. The last one, while potentially valid, should not be found as this could also be in the form of (...panel B. The next sentence...)

passages.text: We found microbacterium halophilum in stool, and Methylomonas Fodinarum together with corynascella Humicola. We also found methanobrevibacter and H. Marismortui in these samples.

infons.section_title_1: These are made up families and orders to test the DL algorithms and their generalisability relating to potential false positives.

passages.text: These are various plausible names for different taxonomic ranks such as Habenerococcaceae and Tabascodiales, but also Cholulamycetes.
